paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR variant V122I, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.demographics: Predominantly African ancestry, average age 59.6 years
patients.phenotype: Common hATTR amyloidosis manifestations including polyneuropathy, cardiomyopathy, heart failure

individual_records.evidence_sentence: Both diagnosed patients were male heterozygous carriers, diagnosed at ages 75.9 and 71.9 years, and with cardiac manifestations of disease diagnosed during study follow-up.
Both diagnosed patients were male heterozygous carriers, diagnosed at ages 75.9 and 71.9 years, and with cardiac manifestations of disease diagnosed during study follow-up.

functional_data.summary: The V122I variant is associated with increased risk of hATTR amyloidosis manifestations.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the affected individuals.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple studies and associations.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is significantly associated with polyneuropathy and other hATTR manifestations.
key_quotes: V122I was significantly associated with polyneuropathy in the UK Biobank (odds ratio [OR] = 6.4, 95% confidence interval [CI] 2.6–15.6, p = 4.2 × 10−5).
By age 75, 37.4% of V122I carriers had at least one of these manifestations.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
